creator: mkoehle
title: Faking a Color 3d Print
materials_required: Laser cutter (or similar method of cutting paper)
description: This project demonstrates how to simulate a color 3D print by stacking paper slices. Each slice has a printed section of a 2D image projected onto the model, creating the illusion of color when assembled.
steps: Create a projection image by taking a screenshot of your textured model (or using a standalone image) with parallel projection and aligned to the x-axis. Crop and resize the image to match the model's dimensions.
Slice the 3D model along the z-axis at a specified spacing using a slicing program or custom code. The slices are exported as SVG files, including optional holes for guide rods.
Slice the projection image by taking a row of pixels at each slice's z-height and stretching it across the output image. The height of the output image should match the model's y-length.
Print the sliced images and model outlines onto paper, ensuring proper centering and no scaling. Number each slice for correct assembly.
Cut out the printed model outlines from the paper using a laser cutter or craft cutter.
Assemble the slices by feeding them onto guide rods, adding washers (if used) between each slice to maintain spacing.
